q1.question: What exactly is an MVP?
q1.answer: A Minimum Viable Product is the simplest version of your product that provides real value to users. It's about quickly learning whether your idea works before investing a lot of time and money.

q2.question: How long does development take?
q2.answer: Typically 4-8 weeks, depending on scope. We work in weekly sprints with regular demos so you can see progress and give feedback.

q3.question: What happens after launch?
q3.answer: You receive complete documentation and access to all code. We offer optional maintenance contracts, but you're not tied to us - everything belongs to you.

q4.question: What technologies do you use?
q4.answer: Next.js, React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, PostgreSQL or Supabase. Modern, proven tools with a large community and good documentation.

principles.title: Our principles
principles.subtitle: Using AI responsibly means for us:

noPurpose.title: Not an end in itself
noPurpose.description: We only use AI where it brings measurable value - not because it's trendy.

privacy.title: Privacy first
privacy.description: Your data stays protected. We use European or self-hosted solutions where necessary.

explainable.title: Explainable & transparent
explainable.description: You understand what the AI does and can trace decisions.

humanInLoop.title: Human stays in the loop
humanInLoop.description: AI supports and accelerates, but doesn't replace human decision-making.

cta.title: Do you have a use case in mind?
cta.subtitle: Let's check together whether AI makes sense for your use case - and if so, how.

hero.title: What we've built
hero.subtitle: Selected projects from AI solutions, process automation, internal tools and data pipelines.

aiVideo.title: AI-Powered Marketing Video Generation
aiVideo.description: A marketing agency needed to generate diverse video content from single images at scale. We built an Airtable interface connected to a complex n8n workflow that generates videos using OpenAI and Ideogram, adds multi-language captions automatically, and exports structured data to Google Sheets for further distribution.

aiPhone.title: AI Voice Agent for Customer Support
aiPhone.description: A construction company needed to handle customer inquiries about project status around the clock. We built an AI phone agent using 11Labs voice technology integrated with n8n workflows. The agent accesses real-time project data from Airtable, answers questions naturally, and logs all interactions automatically.
aiPhone.result1: 85% of inquiries handled without human intervention

stripeRefund.title: Automated Refund Processing System
stripeRefund.description: An e-commerce business processing daily refunds needed a faster, error-free solution. We integrated Lexoffice accounting software with Airtable and Stripe, enabling one-click refunds through a simple checkbox interface that triggers automated Make.com workflows.
stripeRefund.result1: Processing time reduced from 15 min to 30 sec
stripeRefund.result3: Zero manual errors in refund handling

carSupplier.title: Car Supplier Data Integration
carSupplier.description: A car reseller needed to aggregate vehicle data from multiple suppliers, enrich it with third-party services, and sync to their sales platform. We built a comprehensive Make.com automation that pulls data, enriches listings with market data, and uploads them to their Bubble.io platform.
carSupplier.result2: 3 supplier APIs unified into one pipeline

invoicing.title: Automated Invoicing System
invoicing.description: A client with complex invoicing needs required a system to handle multiple use cases: creating, editing, canceling, and reissuing invoices. We built an n8n-powered solution with an intuitive Airtable interface that automates all invoice workflows with full audit trails.
invoicing.result2: Edit, cancel, and reissue with one click

invoiceDistribution.title: Invoice Generation & Distribution
invoiceDistribution.description: A company needed automated invoice generation based on transaction types and timing, with proper filing and delivery. We built a Make.com workflow that generates invoices, saves them to organized Google Drive folders, updates Airtable records, and emails them to clients automatically.

financialFolders.title: Financial Folder Organization
financialFolders.description: A finance department needed dynamic folder structures in Google Drive for international accounting requirements. We created a Make.com automation that generates folder hierarchies based on accounting rules, ensuring invoices are automatically distributed to the correct locations.
financialFolders.result1: Dynamic folder creation based on rules

volunteerTool.title: Volunteer Management Platform
volunteerTool.description: A non-profit volunteering agency needed an internal tool to manage applicants through a complex process including background checks, references, and parental approvals. We built a WeWeb application with Xano backend featuring role-based permissions and sophisticated authentication flows.

salesPipeline.title: End-to-End Lead Generation Pipeline
salesPipeline.description: A sales team needed a unified system to manage leads across multiple platforms. We built 14 interconnected n8n workflows orchestrating data between Airtable, Supabase, Smartlead, and Heyreach, with a single source of truth database handling all edge cases and sync scenarios.
salesPipeline.result2: Single source of truth for all lead data

custom.title: Custom project?
custom.subtitle: The packages don't fit? No problem. We're happy to create a custom quote for your specific project.

q1.question: How does pricing work?
q1.answer: After a free consultation and the discovery phase, you receive a binding fixed-price quote. No surprises.

q2.question: What's not included in the price?
q2.answer: External costs like hosting, domains, or licenses for third-party tools are charged separately. But we're happy to advise on cost-effective options.

q3.question: Do you offer payment plans?
q3.answer: Yes, for larger projects payment plans are possible. Typically 30% at start, 30% after design approval, 40% at handover.

q4.question: What happens with scope changes?
q4.answer: Changes are possible. We transparently communicate the impact on time and budget before you make a decision.

cta.title: Free consultation
cta.subtitle: Let's talk about your project with no obligation. Afterwards you'll know exactly what's possible and what it costs.

hero.title: A small team with big impact
hero.subtitle: Z-Flow is an engineering studio from Berlin. We're a core team of founders and developers that draws on a curated network of specialists for larger projects.

story.title: Why Z-Flow?
story.p1: We've worked at agencies and startups and observed two things: Either things were built fast but sloppy, or clean but way too slow.
story.p2: Z-Flow is our approach to combining both. With modern tools, clear processes and focused teams, we manage to deliver fast without building up technical debt.
story.p3: "Speed with standards" isn't just a slogan - it's how we work.

network.title: Lean team + expert network
network.subtitle: We keep the core team small and work with trusted freelancers from our network for specialized tasks.
network.benefit2: Access to specialist knowledge when needed

speed.title: Speed with Standards
speed.description: Being fast without sacrificing quality. We deliver in weeks, not months - with code that's still maintainable years later.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.description: No hidden costs, no surprises. You always know where we stand and what comes next.

ownership.title: Ownership
ownership.description: Everything we build belongs to you. Complete documentation, no vendor lock-in, you can continue development yourself at any time.

pragmatism.title: Pragmatism
pragmatism.description: The best solution is the one that works. We choose technologies based on benefits, not hype.

cta.title: Let's work together
cta.subtitle: We look forward to hearing about your project.

hero.title: Let's talk
hero.subtitle: Tell us about your project. We'll get back to you within 24 hours.

vatId.title: VAT ID
vatId.text: VAT identification number according to § 27 a of the German VAT law:

responsible.title: Responsible for content according to § 55 Abs. 2 RStV

dispute.title: Dispute resolution
dispute.text1: The European Commission provides a platform for online dispute resolution (OS):
dispute.text2: You can find our email address above in the imprint.
dispute.text3: We are not willing or obliged to participate in dispute resolution proceedings before a consumer arbitration board.

liability.title: Liability for content
liability.text1: As a service provider, we are responsible for our own content on these pages according to general laws pursuant to § 7 para. 1 TMG. According to §§ 8 to 10 TMG, however, we as a service provider are not obligated to monitor transmitted or stored third-party information or to investigate circumstances that indicate illegal activity.
liability.text2: Obligations to remove or block the use of information according to general laws remain unaffected. However, liability in this regard is only possible from the point in time at which a concrete legal violation becomes known. Upon becoming aware of corresponding legal violations, we will remove this content immediately.

links.title: Liability for links
links.text1: Our offer contains links to external third-party websites over whose content we have no influence. Therefore, we cannot accept any liability for this external content. The respective provider or operator of the pages is always responsible for the content of the linked pages.
links.text2: However, a permanent content control of the linked pages is not reasonable without concrete evidence of a violation of the law. Upon becoming aware of legal violations, we will remove such links immediately.

copyright.title: Copyright
copyright.text1: The content and works created by the site operators on these pages are subject to German copyright law. Duplication, processing, distribution, and any kind of utilization outside the limits of copyright law require the written consent of the respective author or creator.
copyright.text2: Insofar as the content on this page was not created by the operator, the copyrights of third parties are respected. Should you become aware of a copyright infringement, please inform us accordingly. Upon becoming aware of legal violations, we will remove such content immediately.

general.title: General information
general.text: The following information provides a simple overview of what happens to your personal data when you visit this website. Personal data is any data that can be used to personally identify you.

collection.title: Data collection on this website
collection.whoResponsible: Who is responsible for data collection on this website?
collection.whoResponsibleText: Data processing on this website is carried out by the website operator. You can find their contact details in the imprint of this website.
collection.howCollect: How do we collect your data?
collection.howCollectText: Your data is collected on the one hand by you providing it to us. This can be, for example, data that you enter in a contact form.
collection.automaticText: Other data is collected automatically or with your consent when you visit the website by our IT systems. This is mainly technical data (e.g. internet browser, operating system or time of page access).

hosting.title: 2. Hosting
hosting.text: This website is hosted by Vercel Inc. When you visit this website, various data is automatically collected by Vercel for technical and security purposes. This includes the IP address, browser type, operating system, and timestamp.
hosting.details: For more information, see Vercel's privacy policy:

privacy.title: Data protection
privacy.text: The operators of this site take the protection of your personal data very seriously. We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with the statutory data protection regulations and this privacy policy.

responsible.title: Responsible party
responsible.intro: The responsible party for data processing on this website is:

duration.title: Storage duration
duration.text: Unless a more specific storage period is specified within this privacy policy, your personal data will remain with us until the purpose for data processing ceases to apply.

revocation.title: Revocation of your consent to data processing
revocation.text: Many data processing operations are only possible with your express consent. You can revoke consent you have already given at any time. The legality of the data processing carried out before the revocation remains unaffected by the revocation.

portability.title: Right to data portability
portability.text: You have the right to have data that we process automatically on the basis of your consent or in fulfillment of a contract handed over to you or to a third party in a common, machine-readable format.

access.title: Information, deletion and correction
access.text: Within the framework of the applicable legal provisions, you have the right at any time to free information about your stored personal data, its origin and recipient and the purpose of data processing and, if necessary, a right to correction or deletion of this data.

form.title: Contact form
form.text: If you send us inquiries via the contact form, your details from the inquiry form, including the contact details you provide there, will be stored by us for the purpose of processing the inquiry and in case of follow-up questions. We do not pass on this data without your consent.

email.title: Inquiry by email
email.text: If you contact us by email, your inquiry including all personal data resulting from it (name, inquiry) will be stored and processed by us for the purpose of processing your request.

fonts.title: Google Fonts (local hosting)
fonts.text: This site uses Google Fonts for the uniform display of fonts. The fonts are installed locally; no connection to Google servers is established.
